com.mobixell.xtt
Class FunctionModule_SMTP

java.lang.Object
  com.mobixell.xtt.FunctionModule
      com.mobixell.xtt.FunctionModule_SMTP
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Object>
public class FunctionModule_SMTP
extends FunctionModule

FunctionModule_SMTP provides HTTP and HTTPS GET functions.

startSMTPServer

public boolean startSMTPServer(String[] parameters)
starts the SMTPServer as an instance of SMTPServer.

Parameters:
parameters - array of String containing the parameters. parameters[0] argument is always the method name, parameters[1] argument is the SMTPServer port, parameters[2] is the SMTPServer hostName, parameters[3] argument is the number of SMTPServer threads, parameters[4] argument is the SMTPServer timeout. If only parameters[0] is submitted the parameters will be taken from the configuration xml document in XTTProperties. If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.
See Also:
SMTPServer, SMTPWorker, XTTProperties

stopSMTPServer

public boolean stopSMTPServer(String[] parameters)
stops the SMTPServer and all it's threads.

Parameters:
parameters - array of String containing the parameters. parameters[0] argument is always the method name, no additional parameters are requeired. If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.
See Also:
SMTPServer.stopGracefully()

clearHeader

public void clearHeader(String[] parameters)
remove all the headers that are to be sent from the client to the server.

Parameters:
parameters - array of String containing the parameters. parameters[0] argument is always the method name, no additional parameters are requeired. If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.

setHeader

public void setHeader(String[] parameters)
set the smtp headers to be sent from the client to the server.

Parameters:
parameters - array of String containing the parameters. parameters[0] argument is always the method name, parameters[1] argument is the header key, parameters[2] argument and following are concatenated together to the header value. If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.

checkServerHeader

public void checkServerHeader(String[] parameters)
compare the http headers received by the server from the client with a value.

Parameters:
parameters - array of String containing the parameters. parameters[0] argument is always the method name, parameters[1] argument is the RCPT TO Address, parameters[2] argument is the header key, parameters[3] argument and following are concatenated together to the header value. If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.

checkServerHeaderPart

public void checkServerHeaderPart(String[] parameters)
check a http header received by the server from the client does contain a value.

Parameters:
parameters - array of String containing the parameters. parameters[0] argument is always the method name, parameters[1] argument is the RCPT TO Address, parameters[2] argument is the header key, parameters[3] argument and following are concatenated together to the header value part. If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.

checkServerHeaderNotPart

Parameters:
parameters - array of String containing the parameters. parameters[0] argument is always the method name, parameters[1] argument is the RCPT TO Address, parameters[2] argument is the header key, parameters[3] argument and following are concatenated together to the header value part. If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.

setExtendedStoreHeader

setPerWorkerDelay

public void setPerWorkerDelay(String[] parameters)
Sets a delay which will delay the response by delay*workerid miliseconds, nice if you know parallel connections get opened in order so you can keep the responses in order

Parameters:
parameters - array of String containing the parameters.
parameters[0] argument is always the method name,
parameters[1] is a delay which will delay the response by (delay*(workerid+1)) miliseconds.
If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.
See Also:
SMTPWorker.setPerWorkerDelay(int)

setNextMessageDelay

public void setNextMessageDelay(String[] parameters)
Set a edelay for the SMSC befroe reading the next message. This should give time to check the recieved data before the next message arrives.

Parameters:
parameters - array of String containing the parameters. parameters[0] argument is always the method name, parameters[1] argument is delay time in miliseconds, If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.
See Also:
MMSDecoder
